etymology.description: 皿(皿) (mǐn, "vessel") + 盍(盍) phonetic = original depiction: lid on a vessel -> phonetic 洛(洛) (luò) added to give sound similarity to 箝(箝) (qián, "to pinch") -> used for linguistic borrowing to evoke rhetorical question "why not"
etymology.interpretation: 盍(盍) (hé, "why not") depicts a lid on a vessel originally, combined with a phonetic component to approximate the pronunciation. This character was borrowed to express rhetorical questioning in classical Chinese.

examples.chinese: 春风拂面(春風拂面)，盍行赏花(盍行賞花)。
examples.english: The spring breeze caresses your face, why not go and admire the flowers.

examples.chinese: 时光宝贵(時光寶貴)，盍共度良宵(盍共度良宵)。
examples.pinyin: Shíguāng bǎoguì, hé gòng dù liángxiāo.
examples.english: Time is precious, why not spend a delightful evening together.

examples.chinese: 君子多谋(君子多謀)，盍游名山(盍遊名山)。
examples.pinyin: Jūnzǐ duō móu, hé yóu míngshān.
examples.english: A gentleman is resourceful, why not journey to famous mountains.
